Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: boldface \boldface\ n. a typeface with thick heavy lines; -- also called {bold-faced}. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: boldface \boldface\ v. to print in boldface. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Bold-faced \Bold"-faced`\, a. 1. Somewhat impudent; lacking modesty; as, a bold-faced woman. [1913 Webster]
I have seen enough to confute all the bold-faced atheists of this age. --Bramhall. [1913 Webster]
2. (Print.) Having a conspicuous or heavy face; -- also called {boldface}. [1913 Webster]
Note: This line is bold-faced nonpareil. [1913 Webster]
bold face n : a typeface with thick heavy lines [syn: {boldface}, {bold}]
boldface n : a typeface with thick heavy lines [syn: {bold face}, {bold}] v : print in boldface
